SCP 0.2.4
  • Reference

SCP palette

Source: R/SCP-plot.R
palette_scp.Rd

The default palette for SCP plot function.

Usage

palette_scp(
  x,
  n = 100,
  palette = "Paired",
  palcolor = NULL,
  type = "auto",
  matched = FALSE,
  reverse = FALSE,
  NA_keep = FALSE,
  NA_color = "grey80"
)

Arguments

x

A vector of character/factor or numeric values for color mapping.

palette

Palette name. All palette names can be queried with names(SCP:::palette_list).

palcolor
type

Type of x.Can be one of "auto","discrete" or "continuous". The default is "auto", which automatically detects if x is a numeric value. If it is numeric, then x is interpolated to the palette color of length 100 in ascending order. Otherwise, the color is assigned to x according to its type number.

matched

Whether to return a matched color vector of length x

reverse

Whether to invert the colors.

NA_keep

Whether to keep the color assignment to NA in x.

NA_color

NA colors if NA_keep is TRUE.

See also

Examples

x <- c(1:3, NA, 3:5)
(pal1 <- palette_scp(x, palette = "Spectral"))
#>    [1,1.04] (1.04,1.08] (1.08,1.12] (1.12,1.16]  (1.16,1.2]  (1.2,1.24] (1.24,1.28] (1.28,1.32] (1.32,1.36]  (1.36,1.4]

(pal2 <- palette_scp(x, palette = "Spectral", matched = TRUE))
#>  [1,1.04]  (1.96,2]  (2.96,3]      <NA>  (2.96,3]  (3.96,4]  (4.96,5] 
#> "#5E4FA2" "#83CDA4" "#FDFEBD"        NA "#FDFEBD" "#F88F52" "#9E0142" 
(pal3 <- palette_scp(x, palette = "Spectral", matched = TRUE, NA_keep = TRUE))
#>  [1,1.04]  (1.96,2]  (2.96,3]      <NA>  (2.96,3]  (3.96,4]  (4.96,5] 
#> "#5E4FA2" "#83CDA4" "#FDFEBD"  "grey80" "#FDFEBD" "#F88F52" "#9E0142" 
(pal4 <- palette_scp(x, palette = "Paired", type = "discrete"))
#>         1         2         3         4         5 
#> "#A6CEE3" "#1F78B4" "#B2DF8A" "#33A02C" "#FDBF6F" 
show_palettes(list(pal1, pal2, pal3, pal4))

#> [1] "1" "2" "3" "4"

all_palettes <- show_palettes(return_palettes = TRUE)
